item.title: The CJEU is currently hearing important cases regarding the European Arrest Warrant, questioning whether mutual trust should be blind or general with exceptions.
item.description: Henning Bang Fuglsang Madsen SÃ¸rensen, Associate Professor, Department of Law, University of Southern Denmark The Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) held a hearing on February 15th, 2016, concerning two cases, Aranyosi and Caldararu, both addressing whether surrender under a European Arrest Warrant (EAW) should be refused if there are concerns about potential inhumane prison conditions in the requesting state. These cases, originating from the same German court, delve into the balance between the principle of mutual recognition in EU criminal law and the protection of fundamental rights.
